title: 7-Day Los Cabos Luxury Honeymoon
subtitle: Desert Drama, Pacific Sunsets & World-Class Romance
meta_title: Los Cabos Honeymoon Itinerary 2025 - 7 Days of Luxury in Cabo
meta_description: Plan the perfect Los Cabos honeymoon: 7 days of luxury resorts, sunset sailing to El Arco, desert adventures, and farm-to-table dining in Baja California.
hero_alt: El Arco rock formation at sunset in Los Cabos
introduction: Los Cabos offers a honeymoon like nowhere else: dramatic desert landscapes meeting the Sea of Cortez, legendary Pacific sunsets, world-class golf and fishing, and some of Mexico's finest luxury resorts. This 7-day itinerary blends resort relaxation with unique Baja adventures—from sunset sailing to El Arco to farm-to-table dinners in the desert.
best_time: October to May for best weather; January-March for whale watching
highlights: Private sunset sail to El Arco

days.title: Arrive in Cabo
days.description: Land at Los Cabos airport and transfer to your resort in the corridor or San José del Cabo. The landscape shocks: desert cacti, dramatic rock formations, and that impossible blue of the Sea of Cortez. Check into your oceanfront suite, unwind at the infinity pool overlooking the sea, and watch your first Cabo sunset—the Pacific paints the sky in colors you've never seen. Dinner at your resort's signature restaurant.
tips: Stay in San José del Cabo corridor for quieter romance
Cabo San Lucas is better for nightlife
October-November and May-June offer best value

days.title: Resort Romance
days.description: First full day: pure resort luxury. Wake to waves crashing, order breakfast to your terrace, then claim your beach cabana. The Sea of Cortez is calmer than the Pacific—swim if your resort has a swimmable beach. Book a couples massage for afternoon, then watch sunset from the spa terrace. Tonight, venture out to Flora Farms—an organic farm in the desert with magical outdoor dining.
tips: Flora Farms requires reservations—book before your trip
Ask concierge to arrange transport to Flora Farms
Full moon nights at Flora Farms are extraordinary

days.title: Sunset Sail to El Arco
days.description: The iconic Cabo experience. Morning at leisure—pool, beach, spa. Early afternoon, transfer to Cabo San Lucas marina for your private sunset sailing charter. Sail along the coast to Land's End, where the Pacific meets the Sea of Cortez at the famous El Arco rock formation. Watch the sunset from the water with champagne, appetizers, and just the two of you. Return to resort for a late dinner.
activities: El Arco and Lover's Beach viewing
tips: Book PRIVATE yacht, not group party boat
Afternoon departures (4pm) catch best sunset light
Bring layers—temperature drops on water at sunset

days.title: San José del Cabo Art Walk
days.description: Morning snorkeling at Chileno Bay—one of the few swimmable beaches with excellent reef snorkeling. Lunch at a beach club. Afternoon, explore San José del Cabo's charming historic district: colonial architecture, art galleries (Thursday evening art walk if timed right), and artisan shops. Watch the sunset from a rooftop bar, then dine at Don Sanchez or Mi Cocina.
tips: Thursday Art Walk (Nov-June) runs 5-9pm—time your visit
Chileno Bay has equipment rental on beach
Don Sanchez and Mi Cocina need reservations

days.title: Adventure or Relaxation
days.description: Choose your pace. Option A: Whale watching (December-April)—private boat to see humpback and gray whales, one of the world's great wildlife experiences. Option B: Desert adventure—ATV tour through Baja landscape or camel ride on the beach at sunset. Option C: Full spa day—indulge in the resort's signature journey. Evening: tasting menu at Manta at The Cape or SEARED at Palmilla.
activities: Choose: whale watching / desert adventure / spa day
tips: Whale watching season: December-April, best January-March
Book private whale watching for intimate experience
SEARED at Palmilla requires reservations weeks ahead

days.title: Final Full Day of Bliss
days.description: Your last full day—make it count. Morning golf on a Jack Nicklaus course if you play, or final pool and beach time. Afternoon couples spa treatment to prepare for tonight. This evening: your most special dinner. Arrange a private dinner on the beach, a chef's table experience, or the best table at Acre—a restaurant set in an organic farm with treehouse dining.
activities: Private beach dinner OR chef's table
tips: Arrange private dinner through resort concierge 48+ hours ahead
Acre restaurant has treehouse tables—incredibly romantic
Desert stars are spectacular—find dark spot away from lights

days.title: Departure
days.description: Final morning in Baja. Watch the sunrise over the Sea of Cortez—the desert glows gold, the water shimmers, and you understand why this place captures hearts. Final swim, leisurely breakfast, then transfer to the airport. Carry home tanned skin, full hearts, and memories of Pacific sunsets that will last forever.
tips: Los Cabos airport is efficient—2 hours before international flights sufficient
Duty-free has excellent mezcal and tequila
Request late checkout at booking for honeymoons

practical_info.getting_there: Fly into San José del Cabo International Airport (SJD). Major US carriers have direct flights from most hubs. Airport to resort transfers take 15-45 minutes depending on location—Palmilla/San José area is closest.
practical_info.getting_around: Resort shuttle or arranged transport for most activities. Taxi/Uber between towns. Renting a car gives flexibility for exploring but isn't essential—most couples prefer arranged transport.

faqs.question: What's the difference between San José del Cabo and Cabo San Lucas?
faqs.answer: San José del Cabo is quieter, more romantic, with colonial charm, art galleries, and sophisticated dining. Cabo San Lucas is livelier with nightlife, party boats, and marina action. Most honeymooners prefer San José or the corridor between them for tranquility.

faqs.question: When is whale watching season?
faqs.answer: Humpback and gray whales visit Los Cabos from December through April, with peak sightings in January through March. This is an extraordinary experience worth timing your honeymoon around if you're flexible. Private charters offer the most intimate encounters.

faqs.question: Are the beaches swimmable?
faqs.answer: Many are not—Pacific currents can be dangerous. Swimmable beaches include Chileno Bay, Santa Maria Bay, and Medano Beach (Cabo San Lucas). Most luxury resorts on the corridor have protected coves or excellent pools. Always check conditions.

faqs.question: Is Los Cabos expensive compared to Riviera Maya?
faqs.answer: Generally yes. Los Cabos attracts a higher-end clientele and has fewer budget all-inclusive options. You'll pay more for comparable luxury but get a completely different landscape and experience. The farm-to-table dining scene is exceptional.
